AAn.caption: Max Stacked Events
AAn.doc: For timeline view, the maximum number of events that stack top-to-bottom. For timeGrid view, the maximum number of events that stack left-to-right.   Can be an integer.
AAn.name: max_stacked_events

AAp.caption: Max Event Rows
AAp.doc: In dayGrid view, the max number of stacked event levels within a given day. This includes the +more link if present. The rest will show up in a popover.  A value of false (the default) will display all events as-is.  A value of true will limit the number of events to the height of the day cell. View a live demo.  An integer value will limit the events to a specific number of rows.
AAp.name: max_event_rows

AAz.caption: Global Event BG Color
AAz.doc: Sets the background color for all events on the calendar.
AAz.name: global_event_color

ABC.caption: Event Appearance
ABC.doc: Controls which preset rendering style events use. Possible values:  'auto' (default) - When in daygrid, renders the event as a solid rectangle if it is all-day or multi-day. If a timed event, will render it with a dot. When in other views, will render normally. 'block' - When in daygrid, renders the event as a solid rectangle. When in other views, will render normally. 'list-item' - When in daygrid, renders the event with a dot. When in other views, will render normally. 'background' - See the background events article. 'inverse-background' - Like 'background', but fills the reverse space. See the background events article. 'none' - Wonâ€™t render the event at all.
ABC.name: eventdisplay

ABD.caption: Display Event Time
ABD.doc: Whether or not to display the text for an eventâ€™s date/time. This setting only applies to events that have times (allDay equal to false). If set to true, time text will always be displayed on the event. If set to false, time text will never be displayed on the event.  Events that are all-day will never display time text anyhow.  When this setting is not specified, the default that is computed is based off of the current view. For example, time text will be displayed in all DayGrid, and TimeGrid views by default. For timeline views, it depends on the duration.
ABD.name: displayeventtime

ABY.caption: direction
ABY.doc: The direction that elements in the calendar are rendered. Either left-to-right or right-to-left.
ABY.name: direction

ABa.caption: viewsObject
ABa.doc: if all else fails, leave this as: {}
ABa.name: viewsObject

ABb.caption: You can specify options that apply only to specific calendar views. Provide separate options objects within the views option, keyed by the name of your view.
ABb.name: you_can_specify_options_that_apply_only_to_specific_calendar_views._provide_separate_options_objects_within_the_views_option,_keyed_by_the_name_of_your_view.

ABc.caption: It is possible to customize an existing available view by tweaking settings.  If youâ€™d like to take one of the existing view types, like dayGrid or timeGrid, but display it with a custom duration, like 4-days instead of the stock 1-week or 1-day like is shown in the default text.  We use the views option similar to how View-Specific Options work but with the very important addition of the type property. Also, a date-range parameter is required, whether it be duration, visibleRange, or dayCount.  We have chosen "timeGridFourDay" to be the name of our new custom view.  Also, in the above example, buttonText has been used to customize the header buttonâ€™s text.
